places.generalDescription: CentralWorld, formerly known as the World Trade Center, is a massive shopping complex located in the heart of Bangkok's Sukhumvit district. The mall features eight floors filled with a wide variety of shops offering everything from fashion and technology to beauty products. Visitors can also enjoy dining at numerous national and international restaurants on the upper floor.

reviews.text:
What a great shopping centre! Mainly for the food on the ground level and you will understand if you visit why. Endless selections of cooked foods and all seemingly at a high quality. There is a great atmosphere in this whole area but if you explore further there is at least 8 or 9 levels with lots of shops and places to eat and drink.

There is also a terrace to get a great view of the city! Definitely worth a visit.

I recently visited ICONSIAM Mall in Bangkok and it completely lived up to its reputation as one of the best shopping and lifestyle destinations in the city. The mall is huge, modern, and beautifully designed, offering everything from high-end luxury brands to local Thai shops.

What I found most unique was the indoor floating market concept, it gives such a cultural touch and makes shopping here feel like an experience, not just a visit to a mall. There are plenty of dining options, ranging from street-style Thai food to international cuisines, so there's something for everyone.

The riverside location adds to the charm ‚Äì the views are stunning, especially in the evening. Everything is well-organized, and the overall vibe of the mall makes it perfect for shopping, dining, or just exploring.

Definitely a must-visit in Bangkok, whether you're into shopping, food, or simply looking to enjoy a world-class mall experience.

üõçÔ∏è Impressive but Pricey
This mall definitely lives up to the hype. It's sleek, high-end, and packed with luxury name brands. The views of Bangkok from here are absolutely stunning, and there are a few solid stores worth checking out.

That said, the overall vibe caters more to tourists and high spenders. Most shops are overpriced, and it feels like a curated experience for those seeking American-style retail with upscale international labels.

Will I be back? Honestly, probably not. It's a great visit once, but not ideal unless you're ready to splurge.

One suggestion to the owner: offer a ‚ÄúMega Shopper Passport‚Äù available right at the information desks. It would make Mega Bangna not just a mall, but a must-stop experience for foreign shoppers.

places.name: MBK CENTER

reviews.text:
Great place for shopping while you are here in Bangkok. Levels of different categories of shops you can find here. Prices are not bad.
It's a huge mall, best to spend almost the whole day exploring. From souvenirs to inspired branded goods, there a variety of shops to see. There are also many restaurants and eatery. Halal food can also be found here. Can also walk to the nearby Siam Discovery, Center and Paragon.

üõçÔ∏è MBK Center ‚Äì Bangkok's Bustling Bargain Hub
MBK Center is a lively, multi-level shopping mall that blends the feel of a traditional street market with the convenience of an indoor space. It's packed with mini stores offering everything from fashion and electronics to souvenirs and beauty services. You'll find plenty of massage chairs and beauty shops-especially manicures-lining the walkways, ready to welcome walk-in customers.

The atmosphere is energetic and tourist-heavy, with vendors eager to make a sale. Some shopkeepers can be a bit pushy, especially with tourists, but it's all part of the hustle-and-bustle charm. Despite the crowds, the mall is fairly clean and well-maintained, and the variety of goods makes it easy to spend hours browsing and buying.

There's also a decent selection of food options and arcade-style games for families or casual hangouts. If you're looking for deals, souvenirs, or just a colorful slice of Bangkok life, MBK delivers a memorable experience.

This mall is truly one of the largest and most impressive shopping destinations I have ever visited. From the moment you arrive, you can tell it was designed with both families and individuals in mind. The mall offers a huge variety of international and local brands, so whether you are looking for luxury fashion, sportswear, electronics, or home goods, you will definitely find what you need here. The layout is spacious and well-organized, which makes walking around comfortable even during busy hours.

What I really appreciated is that it's not only a place for shopping but also a family-friendly destination. There are many dining options, from fast food to high-end restaurants, so everyone can find something to enjoy. The kids' play areas and entertainment sections make it easy for families to spend the whole day without feeling bored. The mall is also very clean, well-maintained, and offers plenty of seating areas for rest.

Another highlight is the wide range of caf√©s spread across different levels, giving you the chance to take a break while enjoying a coffee or dessert. Parking is large and accessible, which is very convenient. Overall, this mall combines shopping, leisure, and family activities perfectly. Highly recommended!

places.name: Central Ladprao

reviews.text:
Central Ladprao is indeed a great location, especially for those who value convenience and accessibility. Here are some key highlights:

1. **Easy Access to Metro**: The area is well-connected to the MRT (Metropolitan Rapid Transit), making it easy to travel around Bangkok. The Ladprao MRT station is just a short walk away, providing quick access to other parts of the city.

2. **Shopping Mall**: Central Ladprao is home to one of the largest shopping malls in Bangkok. The mall offers a wide range of shopping options, from high-end brands to affordable local products. It also features a variety of dining options, entertainment facilities, and a supermarket.

3. **Walking Distance**: Many amenities, including the metro station and the shopping mall, are within walking distance. This makes it a convenient place to live or stay, as you can easily access daily necessities and entertainment without needing to travel far.

4. **Plenty of Options**: Whether you're looking for food, fashion, electronics, or entertainment, Central Ladprao has something for everyone. The area is bustling with activity and offers a diverse range of options to cater to different tastes and preferences.

Overall, Central Ladprao is a vibrant and convenient area that combines easy transportation, extensive shopping, and a lively atmosphere, making it a desirable location for both residents and visitors.

One of my favourite shopping malls in Bangkok. It's very huge, super clean (like the majority of malls) and with a vast majority of shops and restaurants. Though it's not located in downtown Bangkok, it's still very easy to reach using BTS. Central Ladprao has a direct connection from the BTS station "Ha Yaek Lat Phrao".

We liked the mall as there weren't many tourists around. Lots of locals enjoying their time there, browsing around and having good food. At the lowest floor, there are nice little food stalls and a supermarket. Then there are also lots of clothing stores and lots of places where you get glasses. On the top floor, there's a huge cinema as well.

You can surely spend a lot of time in Central Ladprao, but I'd recommend you to combine a visit to this mall with a visit to Union Mall as well. It's closed by and can be reached from the BTS station by Skywalk. Union Mall has a totally different vibe, more rustic and definitely cheaper for shopping ;)

It is the most discriminated, rude and arrogant  team of staff I have ever seen in Bangkok or anywhere else. Staff and scalper are smuggling products together, and the store manager was very rude to tourist, deliberately lie and even yell to tourist customer so he can sell store products to scalpers. I was passing by Popmart and saw boxes of stock arriving, so I asked what they are and if they can be purchased by walk in. The store manager look at me up and down, then said they are Labubu, u wanna buy u queue. I said ok, where is the queue, he said, outside, I went outside, asked the guard, he pointed the queue to me. Not too many people, acceptable, so I went back of the queue. After about less than half an hour, queue start to move, a staff start to chat with people in the queue one by one and give them a card. When it's my turn, he said in Thai, of course I don't understand, so I start to ask if he speak English, then he said, we are out of stock today. I was like, ok, then I left. After dinner when I pass by again, I saw him still giving out cards, I walk towards him and ask why the queue back again, is it because there are more delivery? he said no, then I said to him I was there about 2 hours ago, u said the card is finished, why u giving out them now? and when I ask you, why you say no again? He said, I don't recall see u before, today it's over, you may not stand here,while he was saying this to me, another person came, they speak in Thai and he gave him a card. Till that point, I said to him, r u doing this because I am tourist? He said he doesn't cares. You can speak to store manager. Then a scalper passing by with 2 carts of products. I was really upset and went up to the store manager, he yielded at me loudly, saying I don't see you before and I don't have cards now. Whatever u say is not going to change that. Then a scalper next to us saying to me I can sell to you with double the price. The store manager did not say anything and just left. The whole thing became really ridiculous, It's not something must have, so I left, on my way out, another staff continue to give out cards to Thai people, not sure if they are customer or not, and some other tourist who speak English and Chinese going toward the store manager and try to ask how to queue, and the answer was, we finished today. Along the corridor, scalper are try to sell me a Labubu with double or triple price. I am ok with not able to buy when they out of stock, but in this case, I can't not buy because I was discriminated, as I am not Thai. As a county and city that is heavily relay on tourism, a famous corporate with multiple real-estate and shopping malls, This is very disappointing yet even disgusting.

places.name: Terminal 21 Asok

reviews.text:
Terminal 21 is one of my favourite malls in Bangkok.
It has everything you need. Each floor is dedicated to a different city and has different things.

Pier 21 has a wide variety of food, and the food court has the best mango sticky rice in Bangkok. As we are a Muslim couple, unfortunately, we only had vegetarian food as none of the food was halal. We still  really enjoyed the fruits and deserts. Best thing was the prices, which were very budget-friendly.

But we enjoyed the food festival on the ground floor. There they had some halal stalls.
reviews.author_name: N A I L A Z

reviews.text:
Wow! üòç What an incredible experience! Before heading to our Chao Phraya Dinner Cruise Night üö¢üåÉ, we decided to explore Terminal 21, and honestly, it turned out to be one of the best shopping malls I've ever visited in my lifetime üèôÔ∏èüíñ.

The moment we stepped inside, it felt like stepping into a whole new world üåè. This place is massive ‚Äì around 5 to 6 floors plus the ground floor üè¢ ‚Äì each level beautifully themed and designed with so much attention to detail ‚ú®üé®. The decorations are absolutely stunning üéâüí°, giving a fresh, vibrant, and luxurious vibe all around.

Everywhere you look, there are famous clothing brands üëóüëü, luxury boutiques üíéüëú, and an amazing variety of food options üç£üçîüçï. From Starbucks ‚òï to KFC üçó, and plenty of unique local and international food stalls, there's something for everyone to enjoy.

We spent our time walking through each floor üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è, admiring the creative designs, taking photos üì∏, and soaking up the lively atmosphere üíÉüï∫. It's the kind of place where you can easily lose track of time because there's just so much to see and explore ‚è≥‚ù§Ô∏è.

Before our dinner cruise, this mall visit was already a highlight of the day üåü, and it perfectly set the mood for the rest of the evening üåô‚ú®. Terminal 21 is a WOW factor shopping destination ‚Äì a mix of style, luxury, and fun all under one roof üõçÔ∏èüèÜ.

If you're in Bangkok, I highly recommend adding this to your must-visit list ‚úÖ ‚Äì you won't regret it!
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è ‚Äì Absolute perfection!

One of the nicest shopping malls I've ever been to - beautifully decorated and incredibly cozy.
Themed like an international airport, each floor takes you on a mini global tour.
The mall offers luggage services so it's super convenient for travellers.

places.generalDescription: Central Pinklao is a massive six-floor shopping complex in Thonburi, Bangkok. It's part of the Central Group's impressive portfolio of malls across Thailand. The mall offers a diverse range of shops, from luxury brands to local favorites, making it a go-to destination for fashion and electronics. Its food court provides an array of dining options catering to various tastes, while entertainment facilities like a cinema and arcade keep visitors engaged.

sources.snippet: Thonburi boasts some of the largest shopping malls in Bangkok, and Central Plaza Pinklao with its six floors of premium luxury shops, supermarkets, department stores, restaurants, cafes and a cinema, lives up to that category. The Central Group owns several malls across Thailand. Central Pinklao is one of its projects, which is impressive in its size and extravagant features.
sources.shortName: 20 Shopping Malls in Bangkok for Modern Shopaholics in 2024

places.name: Central Pinklao

reviews.text: I really like this shopping mall and have visited here regularly the past 5 years. There's a lot of shopping, delicious food, clean restrooms, a nice cinema and very friendly staff working here. The girls at the information desk are super helpful, speak good english and very knowledgeable about the location of every single store. This time of year comes with a beautiful christmas tree and accompanying holiday music to get you in the right mood. And when I was leaving today with several heavy grocery bags and got to the escalator that takes you to the taxis a male employer (security guard?) without hesitation ran over to help carry the bags for me and another was waiting outside and opened the car door. Just always such a pleasure to come here üôè

I have been visiting this mall quite frequently for the past 5 years. It's a convenient 20‚Äì40 minute drive from Mahidol University, Salaya Campus, depending on traffic.

The mall offers a wide variety of dining options, various retail shops, and a Major Cineplex for moviegoers. Some of my favorite spots include Sushiro, Momo Paradise, Spaghetti Factory, and Starbucks.

Central Pinklao offers almost everything you'd find in the heart of Bangkok-like CentralWorld, Siam Paragon, or the EmDistrict-just in a less crowded and more accessible setting. It's a great choice for shopping, dining, or simply spending a relaxing day.

Did not have a great experience when visiting in August 2025. There were many constructions ongoing in the mall, leaving multiple escalators that did not work. You have to walk far to find the next escalator that goes in the direction that you want.

The signage for the toilet at G Floor is a disaster. I followed it and always lead to a place where there were no toilets. It is very unclear where the toilets are. The queue for women was very big as well, 15 minutes of queueing. This is not good and should be improved.

places.generalDescription: Asiatique The Riverfront is a unique open-air mall and night market located along the Chao Praya River in Bangkok. It offers stunning views of the river, featuring a 200-foot-tall Ferris wheel and a two-story merry-go-round. This former international trade port has been transformed into a shopping and cultural hub, with boutiques, restaurants, and traditional Thai performances like Muay Thai Live and mini-puppetry shows.

sources.snippet: If you want to try something a little different, the alfresco Asiatique shopping area (Bangkok Asiatique: The Riverfront) might be for you. Situated on the banks of Bangkok‚Äôs Chao Phraya river, Asiatique Riverfront offers a mix of permanent shops, night market stalls, restaurants and entertainment plus you can arrive in style via the free river shuttle (from the pier near Saphan Taksin BTS station). Asiatique Riverfront is a night-time shopper‚Äôs and food lover‚Äôs paradise, billed as Bangkok‚Äôs first ‚Äòlarge-scale riverside shopping centre‚Äô.
sources.shortName: Bangkok Shopping Malls Guide - 27 Best Bangkok Malls with Photos 2024

sources.snippet: Bangkok‚Äôs largest open-air mall is a lot of fun, with a massive open-air night market, over 40 restaurants and the city‚Äôs tallest Ferris wheel. There‚Äôs a traditional Thai puppet theatre and Calypso Cabaret that are perfect for entertaining kids, but only a walk around Asiatique is a history lesson in itself: the mall recreates the time of King Chulalongkorn‚Äôs reign from 1868 to 1910. You can see an old sawmill, a former World War II bomb shelter and even watch a working replica of Bangkok‚Äôs tram system from the olden days.

sources.snippet: Asiatique combines Bangkok‚Äôs two most popular shopping experiences: the night market and the shopping mall. This Bangkok shopping mall hosts traditional Thai dance shows, live music concerts, cultural shows, galleries, art exhibitions, and all sorts of cultural and modern events. Asiatique, the Riverfront shopping mall, is huge and has a historical theme spanning the reign of King Chulalongkorn (1868‚Äì1910) to the present day.

With over 1,500 boutiques and stores, the market invites you to browse and discover.

places.name: Asiatique The Riverfront

reviews.text:
A more high-end market, clearly designed for tourists and noticeably fancier than the typical street markets in Bangkok, with higher prices to match.
Beautifully located right in front of the river, which adds a special charm to the atmosphere.
I lived nearby during my stay, so I visited several times. The market has a large indoor food hall and an outdoor area filled with hundreds of food kiosks. I had tom yum at one of the restaurants , it was delicious and also tried fresh fruits from the market.
Overall, a very elegant and enjoyable place to explore.

A beautiful park for a relaxing walk, with lovely riverside restaurants. It's usually quite crowded and popular with tourists. You can combine your visit with a river cruise and buffet, or simply enjoy a stroll, ride the Ferris wheel, visit the haunted house, or explore small shops and dine at local restaurants with scenic views. The food options are diverse and delicious.

This place is really nice at night. On weekends, it's usually full of people, both locals with family, friends and foreign visitors. There's also a checkpoint here for the cruise dinner. You'll find many food options, but for halal food you need to head to Warehouse 7. The food court itself serves only halal food for Muslims. Besides food, there are also retail shops where you can find a wide variety of things. Night view is fantastic! Enjoy the moment.

places.generalDescription: EmQuartier is a contemporary mall in Bangkok that offers an array of international brands and upscale dining options. With nearly 50 food outlets, visitors can indulge in authentic Thai cuisine or opt for familiar Western fare. The mall's unique design features a striking spiral staircase concept, futuristic architectural elements, and a 100-meter long rainforest chandelier hanging from the ceiling.

sources.snippet: A luxury shopping mall in Bangkok with such prestigious shops as Dior, Chanel and Gucci, opulent Emquartier opened in 2015 and is now one of Bangkok‚Äôs best shopping centers. It also helps that it is close to the Sukhumvit / Asok areas, where many tourist hotels are located, plus has a direct walkway from Phrom Phong BTS station. Emquartier is split up into several distinct shopping areas including the Glass Quarter, the Waterfall Quarter, plus the star of the show, the Helix Quarter.
sources.shortName: Bangkok Shopping Malls Guide - 27 Best Bangkok Malls with Photos 2024

sources.snippet: In the pulsating heart of Bangkok, directly opposite the popular Emporium shopping mall, the EmQuartier rises as a modern icon of luxury shopping and urban lifestyle. With its futuristic architecture and an impressive outdoor waterfall, the EmQuartier sets new standards in the world of retail. The EmQuartier is home to an exclusive selection of over 400 brands, ranging from high-end fashion houses and avant-garde designer labels to well-known international brands.
sources.shortName: The 10 best shopping malls in Bangkok ‚Äì Bangkok Insiders

sources.snippet: Part of the EmDistrict group too, the EmQuartier shopping mall is renowned for its elegant design and large selection of restaurants. The huge mall is divided into three zones: Glass Quartier, Waterfall Quartier, and Helix Quartier. The Helix Quartier, with its circular walkway and restaurants surrounding a garden and waterfall, is the perfect place to discover some of the best culinary addresses in the city.
sources.shortName: 6 Best Shopping Malls In Bangkok In 2024

sources.snippet: EmQuartier is a trendy shopping mall in a strategic part of the busy Sukhumvit Road. EmQuartier is the massive and succesx\sful extension of the well-known Emporium shopping mall built-in 1997. The design is smart and easy to navigate, and the highlight is the helicoidal walkway that allows you to browse four floors of good restaurants without climbing a single staircase!

reviews.text: A great mall, I loved all the greenery, the water works and just felt so nice. Definitely worth visiting if in Bangkok. Some nice views are also possible with a viewing area where you can see the city and a small park nearby. Not the highest building around, but definitely still had a nice view for a sunset or even just the city at night.
Great mall with a nice mix of luxury and local brands. The food options are amazing especially I love the concept of the Helix zone with all the restaurants spiralling upwards.

Nice place to hang out. Lots of food options. I food 4 perfume stores which I loved checking out.  We had lunch at the basement. Great food options. Shopped at Zara, Muji, Uniqlo etc. good customer service.

places.generalDescription: Central Festival Eastville in Bangkok is a pet-friendly mall that stands out for its welcoming attitude towards furry friends. The outdoor park provides a playground where dogs can roam and play, while inside the mall, customers can rent doggie carts to shop with their pets in designated areas. This lifestyle community mall offers a variety of shops and restaurants, including popular brands like JASPAL, Uniqlo, and Havaianas.

sources.snippet: Green, open-air area of the mall with a running track on topImage credit: @kadook_talok via Instagram. While most malls don‚Äôt allow pets, Central Festival Eastville welcomes all animal lovers and their furry buddies to roam free. You can visit retail stores with household names like JASPAL, Uniqlo, and Havaianas.

places.name: Central Eastville

reviews.text: The Central Store is a fantastic place with an incredible selection of products for all your needs. From children's clothing and toys to pots, pans, home d√©cor, and Tupperware, you'll find it all here. They also offer items like strollers, car seats, mugs, bathroom essentials, towels, beds, and so much more. The variety is outstanding, making it easy to shop for your family and home in one convenient location. Whether you're looking for practical household items or stylish decorations, this store has it all under one roof. A truly enjoyable shopping experience!

Fun spot to spend the day-plenty of great restaurants and dessert shops, clean restrooms, and helpful services. They even offer a pet-sitting service while you use the restroom, which is super thoughtful.

Overall, a great place to escape the heat and enjoy some tasty food and snacks.

Wow! This mall is truly family-friendly and pet-friendly and they've thought of everything. There are stations to clean up after your pet, a running track to get your steps in, strollers for dogs, and cute little cars for kids to ride in.
All dogs are on leash, and small dogs stay in their strollers while inside, which keeps things organized and comfortable for everyone. The layout of the mall is unique. One part indoors, one part outdoors but covered. Easy to enjoy in any weather.
Beautiful decor, well-maintained spaces, and a genuinely welcoming attitude toward both families and pet owners make this mall a one-of-a-kind experience in Bangkok.

This 5 storey mall building has more than 100 retail shops that are exhibiting the best fashion collection for your wardrobe.

reviews.text:
We liked this mall because it caters to tourists and locals, it is not overcrowded like an MBK, yet there is a variety of food and clothing shops, as well as services. The upstairs layout is a bit of a maze; we walked in circles a bit trying to get our bearings.

The deals here can be just as good as a night market: 250 baht shirts, fast food, and many, many food options. However, there are quite a few mainstream Japanese stores: Muji, Nitori, and Uniqlo, to name a few.

If you prefer an open mall that is less crowded than an MBK or Siam Paragon with nice prices‚Ä¶you found one!

For the kids, there is a skating rink, small amusement rides, and arcade too! For pets, Mr DIY sells thick dog collars and leashes for 55 baht!

places.generalDescription: Central Rama 9 is a modern shopping and entertainment complex situated at the bustling intersection of Rama 9 and Ratchadaphisek roads. This seven-story mall offers a diverse range of experiences, with over 300 shops, restaurants, cafes, an ice arena, multiplex cinema, bowling alley, kids' fun park, and an Olympic-sized ice rink. The mall is home to popular brands like H&M, Guess, Victoria's Secret as well as Robinson Department Store.

sources.snippet: Although not as modern or sparkling as some of the other best Bangkok malls on this list, Central Rama 9 shopping center is still a pretty good place to purchase goods or gifts (especially in Robinsons Department Store) or grab a bite to eat in the Food Republic dining area or outlets like the South Korean Mom‚Äôs Touch burger joint, Ippudo or MK. Nearby, you‚Äôll also find the smaller Fortune Town shopping center, which specialises in photography, IT and computing equipment plus the original Jodd Fairs (which is soon to be replaced by the newer Jodd Fairs Rama 3). places.name: Central Rama9

reviews.text:
Clean and authentic Bangkok shopping experience:

Central Rama 9 is a nicely appointed mall with a great selection of food stalls, wide variety of shops and department stores. It's one of the more affordable malls in Bangkok and has a much more local feel as there are not a lot of Westerners. Despite this, it has a nice Starbucks, a Krispy Kreme, A McDonald's and other western themed menus. The majority of restaurants are Thai, Korean and Japanese themed.

Although a ways out of the center of city, I'd highly recommend shopping here for luggage accessories, clothing and local food compared to any other mall I've been to in Bangkok. That includes Central World, Terminal 21, Icon Siam and Paragon among others.

The staff is very friendly throughout the mall as well!

A nice and clean shopping mall on several floors with several entrances and exits. The mall is very close to the Phra RAM 9 metro station. Most of the interior is in white which makes it feel welcoming and bright. There are plenty of parking spaces and escalators in the mall (in addition to elevators of course).

Central Rama 9 is one of the largest and most prestigious malls in Bangkok, Thailand. It's a must-visit, one-stop shopping destination offering everything from fashion and food to entertainment and lifestyle services."

places.generalDescription: Central Embassy is a luxurious shopping complex and hotel that houses numerous high-end retailers, boutiques, and restaurants. The Eathai at Central Embassy offers a posh food court experience with renowned chefs recreating celebrated dishes from Bangkok's famous street stalls. The building's futuristic design pays homage to Thai temple architecture while offering elite brand names at premium prices.

sources.snippet: Set on the lower floors of the posh, Amanda Levete Architects-designed building, Central Embassy is Central Group's high-end shopping complex, home to global...
sources.shortName: Shopping & Style in Bangkok

sources.snippet: The best shopping mall in Bangkok for pure opulence is arguably Central Embassy, occupying the prestigious Wireless Road neighborhood, renowned as the city's most affluent district. Built on the former grounds of the British Embassy, this ultra-luxury shopping mall houses an array of high-end designer stores such as Bottega Veneta, Gucci, Hermes and Chanel, ensuring a lavish shopping experience. Beyond retail therapy, Central Embassy boasts top-floor cafes, restaurants, co-working spaces, and an open-air bookstore, providing a haven for indulgence and relaxation.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Shopping Malls In Bangkok 2024

sources.snippet: One of the best shopping malls in Bangkok is Central Embassy ‚Äì a landmark of luxury and modern design. reviews.text:
Siam Discovery is easily one of my favorite malls in Bangkok. It gives off a casual luxury vibe that really clicks with my taste-stylish, curated, and totally in tune with what millennials like.

If you're into fashion, lifestyle products, or even unique souvenirs, this is definitely a spot worth visiting. The layout is airy and modern, making the whole shopping experience feel effortless and relaxed.

The centre offers a lot of international brands and a big ‚Äòeco store' as well as various food and drink stands, restaurants and cafes.

The restrooms at this place are well-maintained and spotlessly clean. Additionally, on the upper floor, there's a comfortable area where you can easily find a seat to either work or relax without feeling pressured to make a purchase.

The AC is way too cold so you can't stay inside for too long if you don't want to catch a cold.

Very luxurious shopping mall. Huge and with a lot of shops that are not shops in classical sense. Lots of selling points in the open space of the mall which makes walking though it a special experience. Prices are pretty high as this mall targets the wealthy. Therefore, though it's super modern and nice looking, Siam Discovery feels a bit sterile. There are also less people here than in the surrounding malls.

Siam Discovery has a direct connection to Siam Center and the One Siam Skywalk from where you could easily reach MBK Center.

places.name: River City Bangkok

reviews.text:
River City Bangkok is a vibrant destination, offering a unique blend of art, culture, and leisure. One of the coolest places to chill, it lets you explore diverse art collections-from contemporary galleries to antique pianos and Persian carpets-while enjoying the convenience of boat access from the Chao Phraya River. Located directly opposite Icon Siam, it provides a scenic and relaxing arrival with stunning river and cityscape views as your backdrop.

Beyond its galleries, River City Bangkok also hosts Heavenly Voice Studio and a dedicated Harp Studio, making it a hub for musicians and music lovers. When hunger or caffeine cravings strike, you'll find several restaurants and caf√©s on-site-including a Starbucks-so you can refuel without leaving the premises.

Throughout the year, River City Bangkok hosts a wide variety of exhibitions-from contemporary and modern art to cultural showcases-keeping the space dynamic and exciting with something new to discover every visit. I had the opportunity to perform in the Antique Piano and Persian Carpets exhibition, which was a memorable experience surrounded by rare instruments and stunning decor.

For those driving in, River City Bangkok offers a 24‚Äëhour car park with security guards, accessed via Charoenkrung 24 and 30. The facility accommodates up to 500 cars and provides direct entry to all floors of the complex, plus ample motorcycle parking.

One thing that stands out is the background music played throughout the venue. River City Bangkok might be the only place I've ever been to that plays classical music-like Rachmaninoff's Piano Concerto No. 2, Grieg's Piano Concerto in A minor, Mozart's Clarinet Concerto, or Chopin's Piano Concerto-as ambient music, adding a refined and artistic touch to the entire atmosphere.

Whether you're an art enthusiast, a musician, or simply looking to unwind, River City Bangkok delivers a seamless blend of culture, convenience, and comfort.

A well-designed and sophisticated complex with spacious areas, perfect for cultural events and exhibitions. The exhibitions here are always creative and engaging - definitely worth a visit for anyone interested in art and culture.

Highly recommend checking it out if you're looking for a unique exhibition experience.

There are a few restaurants and drink options inside, though the variety isn't as wide as in larger malls. However, the surrounding area is lively, with plenty of street food stalls and local eateries to explore.

Lovely place to visit! Some really cool art shows and stores where you can buy unique items! We went on a Monday and I would recommend choosing any other day as Monday seems to be the day when most things are closed, but there was still a lot to visit and it's free so no big loss.

reviews.text: Paradise for shopping lovers. The mall is very used and it will take around two days to cover it completely. But the collection is very nice. You will get all the trendy outfits here, but I would not say that the price is very cheap. It is just that you had a good collection at a good price here. Just remember you can Bargain so be ready to negotiate for your shopkeepers

This is one of the biggest shopping malls in Bangkok, packed with endless variety. From casual, semi-casual, and formal clothing to second-quality branded shoes, accessories, handcrafted items, and food stalls-you'll find it all here at very reasonable prices.

The place is massive, spread across more than 7 floors. I visited for 3 days in a row and still couldn't cover the entire mall-it's never enough for crazy shoppers! The market is always buzzing, as many buyers come for wholesale purchases to resell stock.

While prices are fair, bargaining works better if you're buying in bulk. For single items, sellers usually don't drop their prices much. Overall, a vibrant, bustling shopping paradise that can easily take up more than just one visit.

I recently visited Platinum Mall in Bangkok during my trip, and I can truly say it is the ultimate shopping destination in the city. The mall is spread across multiple floors, each filled with countless shops offering an incredible variety of clothing, accessories, souvenirs, and more making it a true paradise for shoppers. What I really appreciated was the convenience of having everything under one roof. From shopping to food courts with plenty of dining options, and even facilities like money exchange counters, it's designed to make the experience easy and enjoyable for tourists. If you get tired, there are places to sit and relax before continuing your shopping journey. Overall, my visit was absolutely worth it, and I highly recommend Platinum Mall to anyone traveling to Bangkok who wants a one-stop place for shopping, food, and convenience.

reviews.text:
A really nice shopping mall with a very modern stylish touch. It has more or less a darker styled theme which give it a special cool look. Definitely a mall for younger adults.

As part of the One Siam Complex, you can use Siam Center as a get through "tunnel" between Siam Paragon and Siam Discovery. Everything is interconnected and so convenient to reach. A perfect mall hopping experience as every mall in Bangkok differentiates from the other and has its own special theme.

Siam Centre in Bangkok is a shopping paradise that perfectly blends modernity with a unique sense of style. Located in the heart of the city, this mall offers a vibrant atmosphere and a wide variety of shops that cater to every taste. From high-end fashion brands to trendy local boutiques, there's something for everyone here.
What sets Siam Centre apart is its emphasis on innovation and creativity. The mall regularly hosts art installations and pop-up events, making each visit feel fresh and exciting. The design of the mall itself is striking, featuring spacious walkways and visually stunning displays that enhance the shopping experience.
In addition to shopping, there are plenty of dining options available, ranging from international cuisines to local delights. Whether you're in the mood for a quick snack or a leisurely meal, the diverse food offerings ensure you won't go hungry.
The location of Siam Centre is also a huge advantage, as it's easily accessible by public transport. It's right next to other major attractions like Siam Paragon and MBK Center, making it a convenient stop for anyone exploring the area.

In my opinion, Siam Center is the perfect middle ground among all the malls in the area. It's also super convenient and easy to get to by public transport, which is a huge plus.
‚ÄãI visited in the morning to try and avoid the crowds, but it was still busy-I guess that's inevitable! I think it's a must-see when you're in Bangkok. I really liked the variety of shops and the layout. Plus, there are plenty of food and drink options on every corner, so you're never short of choices.

reviews.text: Hands down the coolest, the brightest and the most hip shopping centre within that area of Bangkok. I think every major shopping centres in Bangkok have their own unique style and identity, I felt like Emsphere was for us not because it was fairly new ish (I think opened in 2023) but it's well designed, very clean and bright using natural lights well and not feeling to cramped while exploring and shopping, the art and creativity is what I enjoyed the most about EmSphere, and you can randomly buy a car (micro dealership). It felt like prestige on a budget but this place you can buy anything, the quality of items are much higher than most SC but if you want food there's plenty to choose from, we had of the best coffees in BKK here called Beans, being from Australia it was hard to find great warm latte and cappuccino this is the place to grab it from for sure, felt like home. What else can I say, even the lifts and elevators were beautifully designed and one of cleanliness SC in Bangkok by a mile! Colourful, fun with elegant vibes‚Ä¶

Love the modern industrial vibe of this mall-sleek, fashionable, and beautifully designed. The aesthetic details make every corner Instagram-worthy! There are so many great shops to explore, and I'm completely in love with the escalator layout-it feels so dynamic and futuristic. Perfect place to stroll around, whether you're shopping, dining, or just soaking in the atmosphere. Highly recommend for anyone who appreciates great design and a trendy experience!

Trendy, Diverse, Exciting!

EmSphere is one of Bangkok's newest and most exciting lifestyle destinations - it really has everything under one roof. From shopping to dining to unique design elements, it's a place where you can easily spend hours exploring. We mainly went for the food and absolutely loved V-Street, their vegan street food concept. The variety, flavor, and creativity of the dishes were fantastic, making it a real highlight for anyone who enjoys plant-based food.

The interior and design of EmSphere is wild yet thoughtfully done - creative, colorful, and definitely memorable. It feels modern and stylish but still welcoming, with something for everyone whether you want to shop, relax, or eat.

Tips for visitors: Come hungry and give V-Street a try if you enjoy vegan or vegetarian food, but there are countless other food options too. Go during off-peak hours if you want to avoid the biggest crowds and take time to wander - every corner has something to catch your eye.

Overall, EmSphere is not just a mall, but an experience. Perfect for foodies, shoppers, or anyone curious to see Bangkok's newest and trendiest spot. Highly recommended!

reviews.text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è A Shopper's Paradise Just Outside Bangkok!

Siam Premium Outlets Bangkok is hands down one of the best outlet shopping experiences in Thailand. The layout is spacious and beautifully designed, making it easy and enjoyable to stroll around even on a warm day. The open-air concept is refreshing, and there's plenty of shaded seating and rest areas if you need a break.

The selection of brands is impressive ‚Äì from international favorites like Coach, Nike, Adidas, Polo Ralph Lauren, Michael Kors, and Kate Spade, to local Thai designer labels, all offering genuine discounts. The deals are real, and many stores offer additional promotions on top of the outlet prices.

I also appreciated how clean and well-maintained the entire complex is. The staff are helpful and polite, and there are plenty of signs and maps to help you navigate. There's a good mix of food options too, from cafes and snack stalls to more filling Thai and Asian meals ‚Äì perfect for a shopping break.

Transportation is convenient, with shuttle buses and ample parking available. It's an easy day trip from central Bangkok, and definitely worth the visit if you love branded goods at a great value.

Highly recommended for locals and tourists alike ‚Äì you won't leave empty-handed!

Luckily visited this in the evening, didn't suffer the heat. Buildings look fashionable, along with plant. There is a kids play area, friendly for children. Lots of restaurants are situated, as well as coffee/tea shops. Luxury brands are up but didn't have time to check in and compare to shops in famous department stores. Parking area is pretty huge, don't you worry. Still, Thai outlet ain't seem to be a real outlet, like in other countries. Price isn't really discounted, unless that piece is way too old, I guess.

Siam Premium Outlets offers a well-designed layout-essentially a large rectangle with two main aisles running each direction. It's easy to navigate, and there's plenty of shade throughout, which makes walking between stores more comfortable.

The selection leans heavily toward international brands, especially those from the U.S., with decent pricing and occasional deals worth grabbing. Shoe options are solid, but clothing choices felt limited, especially for families looking for variety. The food court is minimal, and restaurant options overall are quite restricted-something to keep in mind if you're planning a longer visit.

Despite the thoughtful design, the outlet didn't feel busy. It's a great concept, but the experience doesn't quite match the potential. Worth a visit if you're hunting specific brands, but not ideal for a relaxed family outing or full-day shopping trip.

places.generalDescription: Bustling mall with shops for electronics, phone accessories, automotive tools, toys & housewares.

sources.snippet: Khlong Thom Center is well-known among older Thais as the place to go for electronics and spare parts. Even today, there are plenty of vendors open and ready for you to strike a bargain on wholesale electronics. If that wasn‚Äôt enough, there‚Äôs also a Saturday night market that has a reputation for having rare toys you won‚Äôt be able to find anywhere else.
sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal Thailand - Things To Do In Bangkok
sources.shortName: 14 Must-Visit Bangkok Shopping Malls For First Time Visitors

places.name: Klong Thom Center

reviews.text:
After clocking endless kilometers walking through shiny shopping mall after shiny shopping mall for Jenn, we needed a place that had the kind of things that piqued Scott's interests. A place with aisles upon aisles of reasonably priced electronics as well as stuff you don't know you need until you see them. We met THE most honest vendor (across from B3-5) who had the type of drone we've wanted to take our YouTube videos to new heights. He showed us all the features, how to properly control it, and ensured there were spare parts.

We compared prices and models in the bigger stores, but his price and quality of product could not be beat. Plus, he introduced Jenn to Thai rap!

This market is is not only a DIY enthusiast's heaven, but also a main source of replacement parts as well as a market for all home and industrial appliances and equipment.  You will find stuff you might not find anywhere else in Thailand. Parking is available, and many other shops selling foods, drinks, cafes, etc, are also within.
The skill of the drivers is impressive. The engine weighs more than him. Balancing the boat with waves and water turbulence is very tricky

places.address: 499 Worachak Rd, Pom Prap, Pom Prap Sattru Phai, Bangkok 10100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Located in the heart of Bangkok's Chatuchak district, JJ Mall is a bustling multilevel shopping complex adjacent to the famous weekend market. With compact stores and vendors, it offers a wide variety of local and unique items. The mall features four stories of shopping zones, including a food court with delicious Thai cuisine and western options. Visitors can also enjoy comfortable temperatures while browsing through the diverse offerings.

sources.snippet: For popular Thai souvenirs such as wood carvings, ceramics, handmade goods, and Thai silk, visit JJ Mall in Chatuchak. You‚Äôll also find trendy fashion, pet accessories, and more. Enjoy the liveliness of a traditional market, which includes shopping, trying authentic local food, and relaxing with Thai massages.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Shopping Malls in Bangkok in 2024

places.name: JJ Mall Chatuchak

reviews.text:
Great experiences shopping at JJ Mall. Excellent services supported by staffs here. For the stones lover, Rabia and Rayyan Gems& Jewellery on the 1st floor near The Pizza Company is recommended.

We can find varieties of stones,gemstones, rough stone, specimen, lucky stone bracelet, natural stone beads, even cut stone and Jewellery here. Really nice place to shop for own stone collection, gifts,
Easy to get to, lots of parking, lots to choose from. Suitable for tourists Buy shop decorations Buy various equipment both kitchenware and home decorations

I found this shop,while walking around JJ Mall floor2, and it was a great surprise! They have a lot of beautiful lucky charms and souvenirs, and the quality is really nice for the price.I really enjoyed shopping here.
If you're visiting the weekend market, JJ Mall is worth checking out. It's much easier to walk around than outside, with good air conditioning and plenty of food options.
I'll definitely come back next time I'm in Bangkok, and I might even order some items from my country!

places.generalDescription: Gateway Ekamai is a stylish shopping mall in Bangkok that caters to the Japanese-loving Thai community. The mall features a wide range of retail stores, including big-box outlets, as well as Japanese restaurants offering authentic cuisine. Its design and offerings reflect a strong Japanese influence, with an array of dining options on floor M such as Ramen Kourakuen and Hinaya restaurant. Additionally, the mall houses beauty shops, clothing stores, an edutainment center, and a large IT zone.

sources.snippet: Gateway  Ekamai is a Japanese mall with shops, big box stores, and Japanese restaurants. The lower floors feature beauty salons, a food court, and small fashion boutiques. There‚Äôs an Apple store, IT City, Samsung, Acer, and Toshiba outlets on the upper floors.

sources.snippet: A Japanese-themed shopping mall connected to Ekkamai BTS Station, Gateway is a great place to visit if you‚Äôre searching for Japanese brand name products or Tokyo-style caf√©s. Otherwise, its location makes it an inconvenient shopping destination.

There are plenty of restaurants to choose from, and the nice thing is that it's not as crowded compared to other malls. They also have a HomePro and HomeOffice inside, which is convenient but quite smaller than other places.
It very nice here, tidy and clean . Have a lot of Japanese restaurant and Korean restaurant. Plus western food. Homepro here too. But less Thai foods .

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Bangkok, Silom Complex has been a bustling hub since 1993, offering an eclectic mix of shopping and dining experiences. This cozy mall features a range of brand-name retailers alongside the Central Department Store, catering to diverse tastes with both Thai and international brands. While it may feel compact with its lower ceilings and limited natural light, Silom Complex compensates with a vibrant food court that serves everything from sweet treats to savory delights.

sources.snippet: Silom Complex, located on Silom Road, is one of the multifaceted shopping malls in Bangkok, offering a variety of shops, including the Central Department Store. Shoppers can find fashion, electronics, and more, blending Thai and international brands. This mall also houses a modern office tower with leading companies, making it ideal for both business and leisure.
sources.shortName: Top 20 lifestyle shopping malls in Bangkok

places.name: Silom Complex

reviews.text:
Such a super convenient complex with a good mix of shops, cafes, restaurants, and banks.
It's air-conditioned and easy to get to from the BTS, win, or on foot.
Great for a quick shop, a chilled coffee break, or just to escape the heat.

Not a big mall, but casual and chic with some outlets not to be found everywhere else ; but many takeaways only; direct access to BTS. Great Japanese and Siamese eateries and retail shops. Information desk at street level.

Actually, it had been a really nice little shopping mall in the past. But these days Silom Complex has changed a lot of shopping stores into service, beauty/health and banking offices. Not many customers as used to, especially in the upper floors.

Nonetheless, there are nice food stalls on the ground floor directly when you enter from the main entrance. There also many restaurants there and in the floor below. You'll find a huge supermarket there too.
